I already reviewed the original Half-life game.
And I gave that game a huge positive review.
But now it's time to review the spinoff game.
There are two half-life spinoffs of the original.
It is the Opposing Force and this Blue Shift.
Both of them are worth a play to be honest.
They expend the story in a really good way.
It's a fantastic nostalgia trip for the veterans.
There's no wonder as to why they are great.
Even after all those years, they are still gud.
These games aged very nicely, it's fantastic.
Even the music and atmosphere feels nice.
This is a piece of gaming history right here.

En soi oui pour les fans de la s√©rie c'est un "must have". On se replonge dans l'univers d'Half-Life 1 lors de l'accident de Black Mesa. Apr√®s j'aurais aim√© qu'il dure un peu plus... en 2-3h de jeu c'est boucl√© :)

A pretty good expansion to Half Life.

PROS:
+Shows another side of the Black Mesa Incident, this time from the point of view of Barney Calhoun, security guard.
+Hard difficulty is generally fair, unlike Opposing Force
+Introduces physical armor feature, meaning you pick up your armor instead of using the HEV chargers
+Xen sections tone down the platforming
+More world building, expands on the secrets of Black Mesa Research Facility

CONS:
-Less weapons than the original Half Life; throughout the game, you only get the pistol, SMG, shotgun, rocket launcher, and other explosives
-Some of the puzzles are very cryptic, especially in the chapter "Power Struggle"
-Enemy placement can be complete bullshit at times, especially in ventilation shafts
-No new enemies

CONCLUSION: Overall, Blue Shift is a worthy expansion to Half Life. While it lacks the innovation of Opposing Force, which introduced new enemies and weapons, Blue Shift dials back the difficulty and length of the game to provide a simple, yet enjoyable experience. 

7/10

Ok, this game is beyond broken. Like there are glitches that only make the game annoying. For example, the only sure way to play this game correctly is by using raw mouse input because you won't be able to look around and, for some reason, Dr. Rosenburg runs away after I have to guide him to where his friend died. 

I do not recommend this game to anyone. Stick with Opposing Forces. Shame on you, Valve.
If not the lack of content, it would've been better than original Half-Life. Campaign is only like, 3 hours. solid 7/10

√â um jogo na minha opini√£o excelente e o mesmo mostra certos acontecimentos do Half-Life 1 em uma diferente localiza√ß√£o do complexo da Black Mesa de um ponto de vista diferente, j√° que nesse voc√™ assume o papel de um seguran√ßa conhecido como Calhoun.

Remember Barney in HL2? Hey that's you!

Many people say that this was the worst expansion for the original Half Life game. I disagree. They are both fantastic, and one is no worse than the other. This one is quite short in comparison to Opposing Force. In both expansions, you do visit/see some of the scenes from the first Half Life game, which is pretty cool. The best part about this game, however, is near the end, where the plot gains more traction. Trust me, you will enjoy the game.
Its a very good game
cheap and amazing

If you liked the original HL, you'll like this one as well. It's a fun little perspective change to play as Barney trying to survive the Black Mesa incident and make it out of the facility alive. One thing I really like is the fact that the game is somewhat shorter than the original HL.

The gameplay is pretty much the same, except instead of the HEV suit you get helmets and body armor you pick up off dead security guards.

If it's on sale for the 99 cents or whatever, I'd get it.

Blue Shift √® stato proprio un coito interrotto, procede spedito fino alla fine fine e si esaurisce fin troppo in fretta. Ottimo ritmo, ogni tanto qualche bug, ma tutto sommato nella sua oretta mi ha divertito; Il finale mi ha lasciato un po‚Äô di amaro in bocca, soprattutto dopo aver visto quello nei due precedenti.

Stavolta me lo sono giocato a facile, perch√© i picchi di difficolt√† durante gli scontri di ogni titolo li ho sempre trovati senza senso, e mi ha sorpreso vedere pure qui la grande attitudine per i nemici di non crepare facilmente.

A parte qualche cameo da parte di Gordon, come l‚Äôaltra espansione, Blue Shift non aggiunge proprio niente a quello che aveva gi√† fatto abbastanza bene Opposing Force.

6/10
